message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY 

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a new algorithm for multi-armed bandit problems, which is a classic problem in reinforcement learning. It also provides theoretical analysis of the algorithm's performance, which is a common theme in machine learning research. Additionally, the paper may also be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as multi-armed bandit problems are often used in decision-making tasks, which is a key area of AI research. The paper may also be relevant to the data structures (cs.DS) sub-category as the algorithm involves maintaining and updating data structures to make decisions. The information theory (cs.IT) sub-category may also be relevant as the paper discusses the regret bound of the algorithm, which is a measure of information loss. Finally, the paper may be relevant to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category as multi-armed bandit problems are often used in control systems to optimize decision-making.
